Description: One small amulet and eight beads in different shapes and materials. A: One small amulet made of a glass-like material in a turquoise colour. The amulet itself has a thin and flat rectangular shape with a lug at the upper end. The area between the lug and the rest of the amulet is tapered and there are two notches at the lug end. The front of the body shows a diagonal groove and at the rear there are two horizontal grooves parallel to each other. Broken off at the lower end. B: Two beads in a thin barrel-shape, one bead made of blue glass and with very shiny surface, the other made of white faience. C: Two and a half cylindrical segmented beads, two very thin, one fragment of a wider bead. The best preserved example is 6 segments long, all made of blue faience. D: Two disc-shaped beads one made of blue faience, one made of ostrich eggshell, slightly irregular. E: One extended sphere bead made of blue faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
